control.name: Radio buttons
control.helpHtml: An essential control for forms, the radio button control will place a set of buttons on the page, where users can select one of the available options. It is possible to have more than 2 options available, and different radio button controls can be linking together by giving them the same group.

property.name: Name
property.helpHtml: Name that can be given to the control. Names are used to help identify controls uniquely.

property.name: Form summary label
property.helpHtml: Summary label to appear at the end of the form. Leave blank to have the control and its value hidden.

property.name: Buttons
property.helpHtml: Defines the labels for the radio buttons. An option for enabling codes can also be used. Codes allow for more precise visibility and validation conditions.

property.name: Inital value
property.helpHtml: Sets the radio button to a given value. Used in conjunction with codes.

property.name: Button position
property.helpHtml: Sets the position of the text around the radio buttons.

property.name: Layout
property.helpHtml: Sets the position of the radio buttons.

property.name: Group
property.helpHtml: Allows you to assign groups to radio buttons. If different sets of buttons share the same group then only one button can be selected at one time from that group.
